intro: Sium nudicaule, commonly known as smallleaf waterparsnip, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wet woodlands. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive pinnate structure. The small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a characteristic feature of the carrot family.
